Posts.Content: Thanks for the Reply. You did not mention if you were in the midst of a prostatitis flare up at the time of your latest PSA blood drawing. That's a bit of a tricky part. I was diagnosed with pudendal neuralgia earlier this year after injuring myself last year while cycling. So far it's seemed like a textbook case but pudendal neuralgia can be fairly tricky. Some symtoms do have a crossover with prostatitis. With these latest numbers I'm starting to wonder.
Posts.Title: New here, recent increase in PSA.

Posts.Content: Age: 46 Not in any PC risk categories. PSA 12 months ago 2.51 PSA 6 months ago 2.62 Current PSA 6.2 with a free PSA of 11% DREs by two different Urologists over the last 6 Months were normal. History of several flare ups of prostatitis in my mid 20s, early 30s with one chronic case lasting 9 months. Has not seemed to be a issue in the last decade though. My Urologist is currently scheduling an MRI, not sure what type, they havent gotten back to me yet. Currently trying to get up to speed on everything. Is there anything I should be looking out for, or pushing for at this juncture? Thanks for any insights you may have.
Posts.Title: New here, recent increase in PSA.
